hm2PlatformRouting.name: hm2PlatformRouting
hm2PlatformRouting.contactinfo: Postal: Stuttgarter Str. 45-51 72654 Neckartenzlingen Germany Phone: +49 7127 140 E-mail: hac.support@belden.com
hm2PlatformRouting.description: The Hirschmann Platform2 MIB for Layer3 Switching. Copyright (C) 2011. All Rights Reserved.

hm2AgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime
hm2AgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.description: HiOS: Configures the exact ARP entry age-out time in seconds. HiSecOS: Configures the average ARP entry age-out time in seconds, with each entry aging out after a random time between 0.5*hm2AgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime and 1.5*hm2AgentSwitchArpAgeoutTime.

hm2AgentSwitchArpResponseTime.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpResponseTime
hm2AgentSwitchArpResponseTime.description: Configures the ARP request response timeout in seconds. Allowable range: 1-10

hm2AgentSwitchArpMaxRetries.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpMaxRetries
hm2AgentSwitchArpMaxRetries.description: Configures the ARP count of maximum request for retries. Allowable range: 0-10

hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheSize.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheSize
hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheSize.description: Configures the ARP maximum number of entries in the cache. Allowable range is platform specific.

hm2AgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew
hm2AgentSwitchArpDynamicRenew.description: This indicates the current setting of ARP dynamic renew mode.

hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent
hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of entries in the ARP cache.

hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak
hm2AgentSwitchArpTotalEntryCountPeak.description: Peak number of entries recorded in the ARP cache over time. This value is restarted whenever the ARP cache size is changed.

hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent
hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountCurrent.description: Current number of configured static ARP entries.

hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax
hm2AgentSwitchArpStaticEntryCountMax.description: Maximum number of configurable static ARP entries.

hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpTable
hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpTable.description: This table contains the per-interface configuration parameters for local proxy ARP.

hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpEntry
hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpEntry.description: Represents a logical row in the hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpTable.

hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpMode
hm2AgentSwitchLocalProxyArpMode.description: The local proxy ARP mode for the interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpTable
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpTable.description: This table augments the MIB-II ipNetToMediaTable by providing per-interface ARP entry information.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpEntry
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpEntry.description: This table augments the MIB-II ipNetToMediaTable by providing per-interface ARP entry information.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIpAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIpAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIpAddress.description: The Type of Address assigned to this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIfIndex.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpIfIndex.description: The Associated IfIndex which identified the ARP Entry. This value must be specified for static ARP entries on an unnumbered interface

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpAge.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpAge
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpAge.description: This defines the time (in seconds) since the ARP entry was last refreshed. This value is 0 for ARP entries of type local(1) or static(3), since these entries are not subject to aging.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpMacAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpMacAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpMacAddress.description: The hardware MAX Address that each interface maps to.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpStatus.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpStatus
hm2AgentSwitchIntfArpStatus.description: The status of this ARP entry. Setting this object destroy will remove the entry.

hm2AgentSwitchArpSparseLearn.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpSparseLearn
hm2AgentSwitchArpSparseLearn.description: This indicates the current setting of ARP sparse learn mode.

hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheClear.name: hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheClear
hm2AgentSwitchArpCacheClear.description: Setting the object to 'flushARP' will flush the ARP cache. Setting the object to 'flushARPWithGateway' will also flush the ARP cache but includes the ARP entries that are used by gateways of routes. Reading the object always returns 'other'.

hm2AgentSwitchProxyArpMaxResponseDelay.name: hm2AgentSwitchProxyArpMaxResponseDelay
hm2AgentSwitchProxyArpMaxResponseDelay.description: Configures the maximum time in ms to wait before a proxy response is sent. Setting this to 0 determines a response to be sent immediately.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRoutingMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRoutingMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpRoutingMode.description: Administratively enables/disables routing on the switch.

hm2AgentSwitchIpDefaultGateway.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpDefaultGateway
hm2AgentSwitchIpDefaultGateway.description: Specifies the default gateway manually configured.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this instance.

hm2AgentSwitchIPAddressConfigMethod.name: hm2AgentSwitchIPAddressConfigMethod
hm2AgentSwitchIPAddressConfigMethod.description: The source of the IP address. User can set the object to none(0) or dhcp(2). Option dhcp(2) enables DHCP client on the interface. Option none(0) disables DHCP client on the interface. Get on this object returns manual(1) only when the interface has a manually configured address.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress.description: The IP address assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask must be set at the same time.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetMask.description: The netmask assigned to this interface. When setting this value, the value of hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIpAddress must be set at the same time.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceClearIp.description: When setting this object to 'enable(1)' the interfaces IP address and netmask will be set back to 0.0.0.0. Reading this object always returns 'disable(2).

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceRoutingMode.description: Enables or disables routing for this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceProxyARPMode.description: Enables or disables proxy ARP for this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceMtuValue.description: Configures the MTU value for this interface. The applicable range is 68 to the <interface MTU value - 18>, in bytes. Get of this object returns the effective MTU value on the interface. Set of this object with a value of 0 resets the MTU to the default IP MTU value on the interface. If a packet is received where the size exceeds the mtu value, an icmp destination unreachable message is sent back to the sender with the current mtu.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceBandwidth.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceBandwidth
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceBandwidth.description: Configures the bandwidth value for this interface. If the returned value is 0, bandwidth for this interface is not configured.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceUnnumberedIfInd.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceUnnumberedIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceUnnumberedIfInd.description: If this object is non-zero, it indicates that the interface is unnumbered and specifies which interface the address is borrowed from.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpUnreachable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpUnreachables
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpUnreachable.description: If this object is enabled, it indicates that ICMP unreachables can be sent on this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceIcmpRedirects.description: If this object is enabled and hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRedirectsMode is also enabled, ICMP redirects can be sent on this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchDhcpOperation.name: hm2AgentSwitchDhcpOperation
hm2AgentSwitchDhcpOperation.description: Renew or release the IP address learned through DHCP. Get on this object always gives none. None means no operation is performed on DHCP.

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceSuppressed.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceSuppressed
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceSuppressed.description: This mib variable contains the following values, which has the meaning as: 'unsuppressed' - The interface is not suppressed 'suppressed' - The interface is suppressed

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNumberOfFlaps.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNumberOfFlaps
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNumberOfFlaps.description: This mib variable displays the number of flaps occurred on the interface

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceCurrentPenalty.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceCurrentPenalty
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceCurrentPenalty.description: This mib variable displays the current penalty of an interface

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceReUseTime.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceReUseTime
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceReUseTime.description: This mib variable displays the number of seconds until the interface is allowed to come up

hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMo.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceNetdirectedBCMo.description: Enables or disables netdirected broadcasts for this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryTable.description: There is no global administrative flag for router discovery. The global routing flag (hm2AgentSwitchIpRoutingMode) will be used for this purpose. If routing is disabled, router discovery is disabled as well.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryIfIndex.description: Interface Number to configure Router Discovery on.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertiseMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.description: Enable or disable router discovery on the interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvert.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvert.description: Maximum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvert.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvertisementInterval
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMinAdvert.description: Minimum time allowed between sending router advertisements from the interface. This value must be less than or equal to hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementLifetime
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.description: Value of lifetime field of router advertsisement sent from the interface. This value must be greater than or equal to hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryMaxAdvertisementInterval.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenc.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenceLevel
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryPreferenc.description: Preferability of the address as a default router address, related to other addresses on the same subnet. This is defined as the larger the number, the higher the preference.

hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertisementAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIpRouterDiscoveryAdvertise.description: Address used when sending router advertisements from the interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanTable
hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanTable.description: A static VLAN for which routing can be enabled/disabled.

hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanEntry
hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanEntry.description: A static VLAN for which routing can be enabled/disabled.

hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanIfIndex.description: The IfIndex associated with this VLAN.

hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus
hm2AgentSwitchIpVlanRoutingStatus.description: Status of Routing mode per VLAN. active(1) - VLAN is enabled for routing createAndGo(4) - Adds VLAN entry for routing createAndWait(5) - Adds VLAN entry for routing destroy(6) - Removes VLAN from routing

hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable
hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressTable.description: Contains a list of secondary IP addresses associated with an interface.

hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry
hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryAddressEntry.description: A secondary IP address for a given interface. This IP address must not conflict with the IP address configured in the hm2AgentSwitchIpInterfaceTable.

hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress
hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryIpAddress.description: The secondary IP address assigned to this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask.name: hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask
hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask.description: The secondary netmask assigned to this interface. This value must be set during creation and can not be changed.

hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryStatus.name: hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryStatus
hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryStatus.description: Creates a new entry in the secondary address table. Allowed values are: createAndGo(4) - Creates an entry in this table, associating the address with a given interface. The hm2AgentSwitchSecondaryNetMask object must be set during creation. destroy(6) - Removes the associated address from the interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpEchoReplyMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpEchoReplyMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpEchoReplyMode.description: Sets the administrative Echo Reply Mode.

hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRedirectsMode.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRedirectsMode
hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRedirectsMode.description: Sets the administrative Mode for sending Redirects.

hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitInterval.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitInterval
hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitInterval.description: HiOS: Specifies the time interval between tokens being placed in the bucket for ICMP Ratelimit. HiSecOS: Specifies the average minimum time between subsequent ICMP packets for each destination, using a token bucket algorithm. In times without ICMP packets, the tokens accumulate to allow for bursts of up to hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitBurstSize packets.

hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitBurstSize.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitBurstSize
hm2AgentSwitchIpIcmpRateLimitBurstSize.description: HiOS: Specifies the number of tokens to be placed after timeout. HiSecOS: The size of the token bucket, fixed at 6 tokens.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressTable
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressTable.description: Contains a list of IP helper addresses associated with an interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpFirstActiveAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpFirstActiveAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIpFirstActiveAddress.description: The lowest ip address of any active routing interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpStaticDefaultPref.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpStaticDefaultPref
hm2AgentSwitchIpStaticDefaultPref.description: The default preference for static routes.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressEntry
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperAddressEntry.description: An IP helper address for a given interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperUdpPort.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperUdpPort
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperUdpPort.description: UDP port number. Received packets with this destination UDP port number are forwarded to the helper address in this entry. A relay entry with port 0 allows dhcp, time, winnameserver, tacacs, dns, tftp, netbios-ns and netbios-dgm relay.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperIpAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperIpAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperIpAddress.description: An IP helper address for packets received on this interface. An address of 0.0.0.0 identifies the entry as a discard entry. Packets that match a discard entry are dropped.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperHitCount.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperHitCount
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperHitCount.description: The number of times a packet has been forwarded or discarded according to this entry.

hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperStatus.name: hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperStatus
hm2AgentSwitchIntfIpHelperStatus.description: Creates a new entry in the Helper Address table. Allowed values are: createAndGo(4) - Creates an IP helper entry in this table. destroy(6) - Removes the IP helper entry.

hm2AgentSwitchClearIpDefaultGateway.name: hm2AgentSwitchClearIpDefaultGateway
hm2AgentSwitchClearIpDefaultGateway.description: Resets the Global Default Gateway address.

hm2AgentRouterRipAdminState.name: hm2AgentRouterRipAdminState
hm2AgentRouterRipAdminState.description: Sets the administrative mode of RIP in the router.

hm2AgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.name: hm2AgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode
hm2AgentRouterRipSplitHorizonMode.description: Sets the RIP split horizon operating mode in the router. A value of none(1) means split horizon processing is disabled. When set to simple(2), the simple split horizon technique is used. When set to poisonReverse(3), the split horizon with poison reverse technique is used. The default split horizon mode is simple(2).

hm2AgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.name: hm2AgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode
hm2AgentRouterRipAutoSummaryMode.description: Sets the RIP auto summarization mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that routes advertized by this RIP router are combined, or summarized, whenever possible into aggregates. When set to disable(2), routes are not aggregated in RIP updates generated by this router. The default auto summary mode is enable(1).

hm2AgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.name: hm2AgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode
hm2AgentRouterRipHostRoutesAcceptMode.description: Sets the RIP host route acceptance mode in the router. A value of enable(1) means that host routes advertized to this RIP router will be accepted (learned) into its routing table. When set to disable(2), host routes advertized in RIP updates from neighboring routers are ignored. The default host routes accept mode is enable(1).

hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetric.name: hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetric
hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when RIP redistributes from other protocols. {0} indicates that the parameter is not configured, this value should not be set. Valid range for set is (1..15).

hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.name: hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured
hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP default-metric is configured or not. Set to 'false' to unconfigure the default route metric. Set to 'true' is not allowed.

hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.name: hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate
hm2AgentRouterRipDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether RIP can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistTable.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistTable
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for RIP. Here, RIP is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, OSPF, Static, Connected.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistSource.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistSource
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistSource.description: Source route, from which RIP can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the RIP redistribution Table entry.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMode.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMode
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMode.description: User enabels/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetric.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetric
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into RIP. {0} indicates that the parameter is not configured, this value should not be set. Valid range for set is (1..15).

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether RIP redistribute-metric is configured or not. Set to 'false' to unconfigure redistribute metric. Set to 'true' is not allowed.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchInternal.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF internal routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal1.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External1 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistMatchNSSAExternal2.description: If this flag is true, RIP redistributes OSPF NSSA-External2 routes. It will be non-applicable, when source protocol is other than ospf.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistList.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistList
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol.

hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.name: hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured
hm2AgentRipRouteRedistDistListConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

hm2AgentRip2IfConfTable.name: hm2AgentRip2IfConfTable
hm2AgentRip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP. Augments rip2IfConfTable in the RIPv2-MIB.

hm2AgentRip2IfConfEntry.name: hm2AgentRip2IfConfEntry
hm2AgentRip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet. Augments rip2IfConfEntry in RIPv2-MIB.

hm2AgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.name: hm2AgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId
hm2AgentRip2IfConfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the RIPv2-MIB rip2IfConfAuthType is md5(3); otherwise, the value is not used.

hm2AgentRouterRipRoutePref.name: hm2AgentRouterRipRoutePref
hm2AgentRouterRipRoutePref.description: The route preference, sometimes called administrative distance, for RIP routes. A route with a preference of 255 is considered unreachable.

hm2AgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval.name: hm2AgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval
hm2AgentRouterRipUpdateTimerInterval.description: Sets the RIP update timer interval in the router. This is the time in seconds between two full routing table update packets.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetric.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetric
hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetric.description: Default metric of redistributed routes, when OSPF redistributes from other protocols. {0} indicates that the parameter is not configured, this value should not be set. Valid range for set is (1..16777214).

hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured
hm2AgentOspfDefaultMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-metric is configured or not. Set to 'false' to unconfigure the OSPF default-metric. Set to 'true' is not allowed.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate
hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginate.description: Flag to determine, whether OSPF can advertise a default-route learned from another protocol.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways
hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateAlways.description: When this flag is true, the router advertises 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 always. Without this option, OSPF will only advertise 0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0 if the router's forwarding table contains a default route.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric
hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetric.description: Metric of the default route, which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol. (0) indicates that the parameter is not configured, this value should not be set. Valid range for set is (1..16777214).

hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricCo.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricConfigured
hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricCo.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF default-info originate metric is configured or not. Setting to false unconfigures the default route metric. Setting to true is not allowed.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricTy.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricType
hm2AgentOspfDefaultInfoOriginateMetricTy.description: Metric Type of the default route,which OSPF advertises when learned from other protocol. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTable.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTable
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTable.description: This table contains the MIB objects required to configure route-redistribution for OSPF. Here, OSPF is the Destination protocol and the source protocols can be any of : BGP, RIP, Static, Connected.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSource.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSource
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSource.description: Source protocol, from which OSPF can redistribute routes. This object also acts as the identifier for the OSPF redistribution Table entry.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMode.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMode
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMode.description: User enables/disables route-redistribution for a particular source protocol.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetric.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetric
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetric.description: Metric used for redistributing a particular source protocol route into OSPF.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricConfigured.description: Flag to determine whether OSPF redistribute-metric is configured or not.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistMetricType.description: Metric Type of routes,which OSPF redistributes from other source protocols. It can be 1(external type 1) or 2(external type 2).

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTag.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTag
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistTag.description: It specifies the tag field in routes redistributed by OSPF.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistSubnets.description: If this value is false, then OSPF will not redistribute subnetted routes.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistList.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistList
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistList.description: Access-list number of the access-list, which filters routes received from a source-protocol. HiOS: Valid access list numbers are between 1000 and 1099. HiSecOS: Valid access list numbers are between 1 and 10000.

hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigure.name: hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigured
hm2AgentOspfRouteRedistDistListConfigure.description: Flag to determine whether Access-list is configured or not.

hm2AgentOspfIfTable.name: hm2AgentOspfIfTable
hm2AgentOspfIfTable.description: The OSPF Interface Table describes the inter- faces from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfIfEntry.name: hm2AgentOspfIfEntry
hm2AgentOspfIfEntry.description: The OSPF Interface Entry describes one inter- face from the viewpoint of OSPF. Augments ospfIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfIfAuthKeyId.name: hm2AgentOspfIfAuthKeyId
hm2AgentOspfIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

hm2AgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag.name: hm2AgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag
hm2AgentOspfIfIpMtuIgnoreFlag.description: Configures the IP MTU Ignore Flag value for this OSPF interface.

hm2AgentOspfIfPassiveMode.name: hm2AgentOspfIfPassiveMode
hm2AgentOspfIfPassiveMode.description: Flag to determine whether the interface is passive. A passive interface will not participate in the OSPF adjacency formation.

hm2AgentOspfIfAdvertiseSecondaries.name: hm2AgentOspfIfAdvertiseSecondaries
hm2AgentOspfIfAdvertiseSecondaries.description: Configures the advertisability of the secondary addresses configured on this interface.

hm2AgentOspfIfFastHelloMode.name: hm2AgentOspfIfFastHelloMode
hm2AgentOspfIfFastHelloMode.description: Configures the fast hello mode on this interface. If enabled, hello packets are sent every 250ms, ospfIfHelloInterval is ignored. The dead interval and spf delay need to be re-configured accordingly for faster convergence.

hm2AgentOspfVirtIfTable.name: hm2AgentOspfVirtIfTable
hm2AgentOspfVirtIfTable.description: Information about this router's virtual inter- faces. Augments ospfVirtIfTable from the OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfVirtIfEntry.name: hm2AgentOspfVirtIfEntry
hm2AgentOspfVirtIfEntry.description: Information about a single Virtual Interface. Augments ospfVirtIfEntry in OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.name: hm2AgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId
hm2AgentOspfVirtIfAuthKeyId.description: The identifier for the authentication key used on this virtual interface. This field is only meaningful when the OSPF-MIB ospfVirtIfAuthType is md5(2); otherwise, the value is not used.

hm2AgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMo.name: hm2AgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMode
hm2AgentRouterOspfRFC1583CompatibilityMo.description: From RFC2328: Controls the preference rules used in Section 16.4 when choosing among multiple AS-external-LSAs advertising the same destination. When set to 'enabled', the preference rules remain those specified by RFC 1583 ([Ref9]). When set to 'disabled', the preference rules are those stated in Section 16.4.1, which prevent routing loops when AS- external-LSAs for the same destination have been originated from different areas. Set to 'enabled' by default. In order to minimize the chance of routing loops, all OSPF routers in an OSPF routing domain should have RFC1583Compatibility set identically. When there are routers present that have not been updated with the functionality specified in Section 16.4.1 of this memo, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'enabled'. Otherwise, all routers should have RFC1583Compatibility set to 'disabled', preventing all routing loops.

hm2AgentOspfSpfDelayTime.name: hm2AgentOspfSpfDelayTime
hm2AgentOspfSpfDelayTime.description: Delay time (in seconds) between when OSPF receives a topology change and when it starts an SPF calculation. It can be an integer from 0 to 65535. The default time is 5 seconds. A value of 0 means that there is no delay; that is, the SPF calculation is started immediately.

hm2AgentOspfSpfHoldTime.name: hm2AgentOspfSpfHoldTime
hm2AgentOspfSpfHoldTime.description: Minimum time (in seconds) between two consecutive SPF calculations. It can be an integer from 0 to 65535. The default time is 10 seconds. A value of 0 means that there is no delay; that is, two SPF calculations can be done, one immediately after the other.

hm2AgentOspfAutoCostRefBw.name: hm2AgentOspfAutoCostRefBw
hm2AgentOspfAutoCostRefBw.description: Auto cost reference bandwidth of the router interfaces for ospf metric calculations. It can be an integer from 1 to 4294967. The default reference bandwidth is 100 Mbps.

hm2AgentOspfOpaqueLsaSupport.name: hm2AgentOspfOpaqueLsaSupport
hm2AgentOspfOpaqueLsaSupport.description: The router's support for Opaque LSA types. This object is persistent and when written the entity SHOULD save the change to non-volatile storage.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbTable.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbTable
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Advertisements
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbTable.description: The OSPF Process's Area Link State Database (LSDB). The LSDB contains type-10 Link State Advertisements from throughout the areas that the device is attached to.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbEntry.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbEntry
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbEntry.description: A single AreaOpaque Link State Advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAreaId.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAreaId
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAreaId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.2 Area parameters
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAreaId.description: The 32 bit identifier of the Area from which the LSA was received.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbType.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbType
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertisement format.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbLsid.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbLsid
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbLsid.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4 Link State ID
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field containing either a Router ID or an IP Address; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbRouterId.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbRouterId
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1 Global parameters
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbRouterId.description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbSequence.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbSequence
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6 LS sequence number
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It starts with the value '80000001'h, or -'7FFFFFFF'h, and increments until '7FFFFFFF'h. Thus, a typical sequence number will be very negative. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number the more recent the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAge.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAge
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state advertisement in seconds.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbChecksum.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbChecksum
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connectionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAdvertisement.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAdvertisement
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Advertisements
hm2AgentOspfAreaOpaqueLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire Link State Advertisement, including its header. Note that for variable length LSAs, SNMP agents may not be able to return the largest string size

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbTable.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbTable
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Advertisements and The OSPF Opaque LSA Option
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbTable.description: The OSPF Process's Link-Local Link State Database for non-virtual links. This table is identical to the OSPF LSDB Table in format, but contains only Link-Local Link State Advertisements for non-virtual links. The purpose is to allow Link-Local LSAs to be displayed for each non-virtual interface. This table is implemented to support type-9 LSAs which are defined in 'The OSPF Opaque LSA Option'.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbIpAddress.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbIpAddress
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbIpAddress.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Interface parameters
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the interface from which the LSA was received if the interface is numbered.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAddressLessIf.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAddressLessIf
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAddressLessIf.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.3 Interface parameters
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAddressLessIf.description: The Interface Index of the interface from which the LSA was received if the interface is unnumbered.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbType.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbType
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header and
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertise- ment format.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbLsid.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbLsid
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbLsid.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4 Link State ID
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field containing a 32 bit identifier in IP address format; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbRouterId.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbRouterId
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1 Global parameters
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbRouterId.description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbSequence.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbSequence
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6 LS sequence number
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It starts with the value '80000001'h, or -'7FFFFFFF'h, and increments until '7FFFFFFF'h. Thus, a typical sequence number will be very negative. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number the more recent the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAge.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAge
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state adver- tisement in seconds.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbChecksum.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbChecksum
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connec- tionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAdvertisement.name: hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAdvertisement
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
hm2AgentOspfLocalLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire Link State Advertisement, including its header. Note that for variable length LSAs, SNMP agents may not be able to return the largest string size.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbTable.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbTable
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbTable.description: The OSPF Process's AS-scope LSA Link State Database. The Database contains the AS-scope Link State Advertisements from throughout the areas that the device is attached to. This table is identical to the OSPF LSDB Table in format, but contains only AS-scope Link State Advertisements. The purpose is to allow AS-scope LSAs to be displayed once for the router rather than once in each non-stub area.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbType.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbType
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbType.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix A.4.1 The Link State Advertisement header
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbType.description: The type of the link state advertisement. Each link state type has a separate advertise- ment format.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbLsid.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbLsid
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbLsid.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.4 Link State ID
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbLsid.description: The Link State ID is an LS Type Specific field containing either a Router ID or an IP Address; it identifies the piece of the routing domain that is being described by the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbRouterId.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbRouterId
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbRouterId.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.1 Global parameters
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbRouterId.description: The 32 bit number that uniquely identifies the originating router in the Autonomous System.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbSequence.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbSequence
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbSequence.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12.1.6 LS sequence number
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbSequence.description: The sequence number field is a signed 32-bit integer. It starts with the value '80000001'h, or -'7FFFFFFF'h, and increments until '7FFFFFFF'h. Thus, a typical sequence number will be very negative. It is used to detect old and duplicate link state advertisements. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number the more recent the advertisement.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAge.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAge
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAge.description: This field is the age of the link state adver- tisement in seconds.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbChecksum.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbChecksum
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbChecksum.description: This field is the checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The age field is excepted so that an advertisement's age can be incremented without updating the checksum. The checksum used is the same that is used for ISO connec- tionless datagrams; it is commonly referred to as the Fletcher checksum.

hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAdvertisement.name: hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAdvertisement
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAdvertisement.reference: OSPF Version 2, Section 12 Link State Adver- tisements. Note that for variable length LSAs, SNMP agents may not be able to return the largest string size.
hm2AgentOspfAsLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire Link State Advertisement, including its header.

hm2AgentOspfDefaultPassiveMode.name: hm2AgentOspfDefaultPassiveMode
hm2AgentOspfDefaultPassiveMode.description: Flag to determine, whether all the interfaces are passive interfaces by default. A passive interface will not participate in the OSPF adjacency formation.

hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefIntraArea.name: hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefIntraArea
hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefIntraArea.description: The route preference, sometimes called administrative distance, for intra-area OSPFv2 routes. A route with a preference of 255 is considered unreachable.

hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefInterArea.name: hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefInterArea
hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefInterArea.description: The route preference, sometimes called administrative distance, for inter-area OSPFv2 routes. A route with a preference of 255 is considered unreachable.

hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefExternal.name: hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefExternal
hm2AgentOspfRoutePrefExternal.description: The route preference, sometimes called administrative distance, for external OSPFv2 routes. A route with a preference of 255 is considered unreachable.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSATable.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSATable
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSATable.description: Information about all the configured Not-So-Stubby-Area(NSSAs) in OSPF. Augments ospfAreaTable from the OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAEntry.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAEntry
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAEntry.description: Information about a single Not-So-Stubby-Area(NSSA). Augments ospfAreaEntry in OSPF-MIB.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAImportSummaries.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAImportSummaries
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSAImportSummaries.description: When set to enabled, OSPF's summary routes are imported into the NSSA as Type-3 summary-LSAs. When set to disabled, summary routes are not imported into the NSSA. The default setting is enabled.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSARedistribute.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSARedistribute
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSARedistribute.description: When set to enabled NSSA ASBRs will not redistribute external routes into the NSSA and they will cease to originate Type-7 external LSAs for external routes.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultInfoOriginate.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultInfoOriginate
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultInfoOriginate.description: Determines if the router will originate a Type-7 default LSA into the NSSA. This command will cause a default LSA to be originated only if the router is an NSSA ABR or ASBR.

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetric.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetric
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetric.description: Defines the metric value advertised in the Type-7 default LSA originated by this router

hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetricType.name: hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetricType
hm2AgentOspfAreaNSSADefaultMetricType.description: Defines the metric type advertised in the Type-7 default LSA originated by this router

hm2AgentOspfIfMetricCalculatedCost.name: hm2AgentOspfIfMetricCalculatedCost
hm2AgentOspfIfMetricCalculatedCost.description: Returns the actual cost value used by OSPF for this interface.

hm2AgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.name: hm2AgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag
hm2AgentSnmpVRRPNewMasterTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP new master notification traps.

hm2AgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.name: hm2AgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag
hm2AgentSnmpVRRPAuthFailureTrapFlag.description: This flag enables the sending of VRRP authentication failure notification traps.

hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount.name: hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount
hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMaxHopCount.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Max Hop Count. The relay agent silently discards BOOTREQUEST messages whose hops field exceeds the value 16 assuming that the request is looped through the intermediate agents. The default value is 4.

hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime.name: hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime
hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayMinWaitTime.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Minimum Wait Time. When the BOOTP relay agent receives a BOOTREQUEST message, it MAY use the value of the 'secs' (seconds since client began booting) field of the request as a factor in deciding whether to relay the request or not.

hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMod.name: hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMode
hm2AgentBootpDhcpRelayCircuitIdOptionMod.description: The BOOTP/DHCP Circuit ID Option Mode. This flag is set to enable/disable the network element to add/remove the DHCP Relay agent Circuit ID sub-options.

hm2AgentECMPOspfMaxPaths.name: hm2AgentECMPOspfMaxPaths
hm2AgentECMPOspfMaxPaths.description: It sets the number of paths that OSPF can report for a given destination where maxpaths is platform-dependent.

hm2AgentRouterVrrpAdminState.name: hm2AgentRouterVrrpAdminState
hm2AgentRouterVrrpAdminState.description: Sets the administrative mode of VRRP in the router.

hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperTable.name: hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperTable
hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperTable.description: Operations table for a VRRP router which consists of a sequence (i.e., one or more conceptual rows) of `hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperEntry' items.

hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperEntry.name: hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperEntry
hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperEntry.description: An entry in the table contains operational priority that is associated with a virtual router.

hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperPriority.name: hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperPriority
hm2AgentRouterVrrpOperPriority.description: This object specifies the operational priority of the VRRP router. This value will be afftected by both the tracking process and the configured priority set by the vrrpOperPriority object.

hm2AgentRouterVrrpNumberOfFastInst.name: hm2AgentRouterVrrpNumberOfFastInst
hm2AgentRouterVrrpNumberOfFastInst.description: Number of VRRP instances with advertisement interval less than one second.

hm2AgentIpHelperAdminMode.name: hm2AgentIpHelperAdminMode
hm2AgentIpHelperAdminMode.description: Administratively enable or disable IP helper.

hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsReceived.name: hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsReceived
hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsReceived.description: The Number of DHCP Requests Received. Total number of DHCP requests received from all clients.

hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsRelayed.name: hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsRelayed
hm2AgentDhcpClientMsgsRelayed.description: The Number of DHCP Requests Forwarded. Total number of DHCP requests relayed to a server.

hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsReceived.name: hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsReceived
hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsReceived.description: The number of DHCP messages received from a server.

hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsRelayed.name: hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsRelayed
hm2AgentDhcpServerMsgsRelayed.description: The number of DHCP messages relayed to a server.

hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsReceived.name: hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsReceived
hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsReceived.description: The number of UDP messages received from all clients.

hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsRelayed.name: hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsRelayed
hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsRelayed.description: The number of UDP messages relayed to a server.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressTable
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressTable.description: Contains a list of IP helper addresses configured globally.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressEntry
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddressEntry.description: An IP Helper address that applies to packets received on any interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperUdpPort.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperUdpPort
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperUdpPort.description: UDP port number. A relay entry with port 0 allows dhcp, time, winnameserver, tacacs, dns, tftp, netbios-ns and netbios-dgm relay.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddress.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddress
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperAddress.description: The IP Helper address assigned to this interface.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperHitCount.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperHitCount
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperHitCount.description: The number of times a packet has been forwarded or discarded according to this entry.

hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperStatus.name: hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperStatus
hm2AgentSwitchIpHelperStatus.description: Creates a new entry in the global IP Helper address table. Allowed values are: createAndGo(4) - Creates an IP helper entry in this table. destroy(6) - Removes the IP helper entry.

hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsTtlExpired.name: hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsTtlExpired
hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsTtlExpired.description: The number of UDP messages received with an expired TTL.

hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsDiscarded.name: hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsDiscarded
hm2AgentUdpClientMsgsDiscarded.description: The number of UDP messages that matched a discard entry.

hm2AgentInternalVlanBase.name: hm2AgentInternalVlanBase
hm2AgentInternalVlanBase.description: The VLAN ID internally assigned to the first port-based routing interface.

hm2AgentInternalVlanPolicy.name: hm2AgentInternalVlanPolicy
hm2AgentInternalVlanPolicy.description: Whether to search up or down from the base VLAN ID for a free VLAN ID to assign to a port-based routing interface.

hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanTable.name: hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanTable
hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanTable.description: Contains a list of VLAN IDs used internally for port-based routing interfaces.

hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanEntry.name: hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanEntry
hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanEntry.description: A VLAN ID internally assigned to a port-based routing interface.

hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanId.name: hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanId
hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanId.description: A VLAN ID internally assigned to a port-based routing interface.

hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanIfIndex.name: hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanIfIndex
hm2AgentSwitchInternalVlanIfIndex.description: Interface index of port-based routing interface using this VLAN ID.

hm2AgentOspfQueueTable.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueTable
hm2AgentOspfQueueTable.description: Table lists information about OSPFv2 message queue utilization.

hm2AgentOspfQueueEntry.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueEntry
hm2AgentOspfQueueEntry.description: Information on a specific OSPFv2 message queue.

hm2AgentOspfQueueIndex.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueIndex
hm2AgentOspfQueueIndex.description: Index value for this message queue.

hm2AgentOspfQueueName.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueName
hm2AgentOspfQueueName.description: Name of an OSPFv2 message queue.

hm2AgentOspfQueueLength.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueLength
hm2AgentOspfQueueLength.description: The number of messages currently in the message queue.

hm2AgentOspfQueueHigh.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueHigh
hm2AgentOspfQueueHigh.description: The high water mark of the number of messages in the message queue.

hm2AgentOspfQueueDrops.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueDrops
hm2AgentOspfQueueDrops.description: The number of items dropped because the message queue was full.

hm2AgentOspfQueueLimit.name: hm2AgentOspfQueueLimit
hm2AgentOspfQueueLimit.description: The maximum number of messages this queue can hold.

hm2AgentOspfCountersCleared.name: hm2AgentOspfCountersCleared
hm2AgentOspfCountersCleared.description: The time since OSPFv2 counters were last cleared, in seconds.

hm2AgentOspfLsaRetxCount.name: hm2AgentOspfLsaRetxCount
hm2AgentOspfLsaRetxCount.description: The total number of LSAs retransmitted since OSPF counters were last cleared. If the same LSA is retransmitted to multiple neighbors, the count is incremented for each neighbor.

hm2AgentOspfHellosRx.name: hm2AgentOspfHellosRx
hm2AgentOspfHellosRx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 Hello packets received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfHellosTx.name: hm2AgentOspfHellosTx
hm2AgentOspfHellosTx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 Hello packets transmitted since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfDdRx.name: hm2AgentOspfDdRx
hm2AgentOspfDdRx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 Database Description packets received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfDdTx.name: hm2AgentOspfDdTx
hm2AgentOspfDdTx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 Database Description packets transmitted since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfLsReqRx.name: hm2AgentOspfLsReqRx
hm2AgentOspfLsReqRx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 LS Request packets received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfLsReqTx.name: hm2AgentOspfLsReqTx
hm2AgentOspfLsReqTx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 LS Request packets transmitted since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesRx.name: hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesRx
hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesRx.description: The total number of OSPFv2 LS Update packets received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesTx.name: hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesTx

hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesTxMax.name: hm2AgentOspfLsUpdatesTxMax

hm2AgentOspfType2LsasRx.description: The number of type 2 (network) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType3LsasRx.description: The number of type 3 (network summary) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType5LsasRx.description: The number of type 5 (external) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType7LsasRx.description: The number of type 7 (NSSA external) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType9LsasRx.description: The number of type 9 (Link Opaque) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType10LsasRx.name: hm2AgentOspfType10LsasRx
hm2AgentOspfType10LsasRx.description: The number of type 10 (Area Opaque) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfType11LsasRx.name: hm2AgentOspfType11LsasRx
hm2AgentOspfType11LsasRx.description: The number of type 11 (AS Opaque) LSAs received since OSPF counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsDeltaT.description: How long since this routing table calculation ran. The time is given in seconds.

hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsIntra.name: hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsIntra
hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsIntra.description: Number of milliseconds to compute intra-area routes.

hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsSpfTotal.description: Number of milliseconds for entire routing table calculation.

hm2AgentOspfSpfStatsReason.description: Reasons why a routing table calculation was required. R - new router LSA, N - new Network LSA, SN - new network summary LSA, SA - new ASBR summary LSA, X - new external LSA.

hm2AgentRoutingHeapSize.description: The size of the routing heap, in bytes. Unicast routing protocols and ARP allocate memory from the routing heap.

hm2AgentOspfIntraRoutes.description: The number of OSPFv2 intra-area routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentOspfInterRoutes.name: hm2AgentOspfInterRoutes
hm2AgentOspfInterRoutes.description: The number of OSPFv2 inter-area routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentOspfExt1Routes.name: hm2AgentOspfExt1Routes

hm2AgentBgpRoutes.description: The number of BGP routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentEbgpRoutes.description: The number of external BGP routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentIbgpRoutes.description: The number of internal BGP routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentLocalBgpRoutes.description: The number of local BGP routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentRejectRoutes.name: hm2AgentRejectRoutes
hm2AgentRejectRoutes.description: The number of reject routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentTotalRoutes.description: The number of routes in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentBestRoutes.description: The number of IPv4 routes in the forwarding table.

hm2AgentRouteModifies.description: The number of routes changed in the IPv4 routing table.

hm2AgentInvalidRouteAdds.description: The number of IPv4 routes adds that failed because the route was invalid.

hm2AgentUniqueNextHopsHigh.description: The highest count of unique next hops since counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentNextHopGroups.description: The current number of next hop groups in use by one or more routes. Each next hop group includes one or more next hops.

hm2AgentNextHopGroupsHigh.description: The highest count of next hop groups since counters were last cleared.

hm2AgentTruncEcmpRoutes.description: The number of ECMP routes that are currently installed in the forwarding table with just one next hop. The forwarding table may limit the number of ECMP routes or the number of ECMP groups. When an ECMP route cannot be installed because such a limit is reached, the route is installed with a single next hop.

hm2AgentEcmpRetries.name: hm2AgentEcmpRetries

hm2AgentEcmpCountEntry.description: Number of IPv4 routes with a given number of next hops.

hm2AgentEcmpRouteCount.name: hm2AgentEcmpRouteCount
hm2AgentEcmpRouteCount.description: The number of IPv4 routes with agentEcmpNextHopCount next hops.

hm2AgentOspfStubRouterReason.description: This indicates the reason because of which the router is in Stub mode. This is valid only if the agentOspfStubRouterMode is 'active'.

hm2AgentOspfStubRouterStartupTimeRemaini.description: The time remaining (in seconds) for the router to come out of the stub mode. This is valid only if the agentOspfStubRouterReason is 'startup'.

hm2AgentOspfStubRouterDuration.description: Time elapsed (in seconds) since the router last entered the stub router mode. This is valid only if the agentOspfStubRouterMode is 'active' and agentOspfStubRouterReason is 'resource-limitation'.

hm2AgentOspfNbrDeadTime.description: The neighbor's Dead Time is the amount of remaining time since the last OSPF hello packet received, before declaring the neighbor status as down.

hm2AgentOspfRouteProtoType.description: The type of route that was learned from OSPF.

hm2AgentVrrpTrackVrid.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The virtual router id for this virtual router

hm2AgentVrrpTrackId.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } The id of the object being tracked

hm2AgentVrrpTrackRowStatus.description: DURABLE: { 1:all } Defines the status of a vrrp tracking database entry. Set to createAndGo(4) to create a new row. Set to destroy(6) to delete an entry. Reads as active(1) if the tracked object exists and is trackable, notReady(3) otherwise.

hm2AgentVrrpExtTable.name: hm2AgentVrrpExtTable
hm2AgentVrrpExtTable.description: This table contains variables to define an entry in the VRRP enhancements database.

hm2AgentVrrpExtIfIndex.description: The interface number of the virtual router
